message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the circulatory system and the role of blood in the body. Blood absorbs oxygen in the organs that develop during childhood, such as the lungs. Option (A) is incorrect because blood absorbs oxygen in the lungs, not the lower limbs of the body. Option (C) is incorrect because the nasal bones are not involved in the absorption of oxygen. Option (D) is incorrect because the inner canals of the ear are not involved in the absorption of oxygen.

This question requires knowledge of the respiratory system and how oxygen is absorbed into the blood. When we breathe, oxygen enters our lungs and is exchanged with carbon dioxide. The oxygen is then absorbed into the bloodstream through the walls of the alveoli in the lungs. This oxygen-rich blood is then pumped by the heart to all parts of the body, including the organs that develop during childhood.
